in_ports.name: while
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] When specified, defines whether the loop should be repeated or stopped.
If not specified, it is considered to be "true"; in this case, you must use "Maximal iterations count" parameter.

in_ports.name: s
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] When specified, this data is just copied to "s" output before all other operations.
Can be convenient if you need to "build" this operation into some chain of other functions.
Other inputs "x", "m" are processed in the same way.

out_ports.name: is_first
out_ports.hint:
Will contain "true" if it is the first iteration; in another case will contain "false".
In other words, returns result of condition "count==0".

out_ports.name: is_last
out_ports.hint:
Will contain "true" if it is the last iteration of the loop; in another case will contain "false".
Actually it is the inverted input "while" condition.

out_ports.name: is_not_first
out_ports.hint: Will contain "false" if it is the first iteration of the loop; in another case will contain "true".

out_ports.name: is_not_last
out_ports.hint:
Will contain "false" if it is the last iteration of the loop; in another case will contain "true".
Actually it is the input "while" condition.

out_ports.name: count
out_ports.hint:
Counter, starting from 0. Will be 0 while first iteration of the loop, 1 while the second, etc.
Note: if very improbable sitution of overflow (2^63−1=9223372036854775806 iterations), this counter stops increasing.

out_ports.name: s
out_ports.hint:
[Optional] Copy of "s" input, when it is specified: see comments to "s" input.
Other outputs "x", "m" are also copies of the corresponding inputs.

controls.caption: What string is true
controls.name: conditionStyle
controls.description:
What input condition "xxx" is considered to be true and what is false.

C-like: true is non-zero number or non-empty string, containing not a number, false is 0, 0.0 or empty string.

Java-like: true is "true" string (ignoring case), false is any other string.

Note that "true" string, according these rules, is considered to be true in all modes.

controls.name: invertCondition
controls.caption: Invert condition
controls.description:
If cleared, the loop is repeated while the input condition "xxx" is true.
If set, this condition is inverted, and the loop is repeated while "xxx" is false.

controls.caption: Maximal iterations count
controls.name: maxIterationsCount
controls.description:
Maximal number of iterations. If specified (contains non-empty string), the loop is stopped after such number of iterations, even if the input while condition ("xxx" or inverted "xxx") is still true.
Note: this parameter MUST be specified if the input port "while" is empty.

REMEMBER: you SHOULD "build" this operation into some chain of other functions with help of input/output ports "s", "x" or "m", so that the final result of the chain will DEPEND on some outputs of this function. This is important: if results of this function are not used, then it is usually ignored when this chain is used as a chain.
